title: If Statements
description: If statements control program flow based on boolean conditions. BPL requires explicit boolean conditions (no truthiness for integers by default). Braces {} are mandatory even for single statements, preventing common 'dangling else' bugs. You can chain multiple conditions using 'else if' for multi-way branching. Comparison operators (==, !=, <, >, <=, >=) and logical operators (&&, ||, !) can be combined to create complex conditions. This example demonstrates basic if/else, else-if chains, and nested conditions.
